inputoutput 1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • input-output-basics

    input-output-basics

    input-output-basics.Rmd
    library(inputoutput)

    Common variables

    Let X be the input-output matrix, w the wage vector, c the household consumption vector and d the total final demand vector.

    X <- transaction_matrix
w <- wage_demand_matrix[, "wage"]
c <- wage_demand_matrix[, "household_consumption"]
d <- wage_demand_matrix[, "final_total_demand"]

    Input requirement matrix

    Let A be the direct coefficients matrix.

    A <- input_requirement(X, d)
A_aug <- augmented_input_requirement(X,w,c,d)

A; A_aug

    Output allocation matrix

    Let B be the output allocation matrix.

    B <- output_allocation(X, d)

    Leontief inverse matrix

    L <- leontief_inverse(A); L
#>              [,1]        [,2]        [,3]        [,4]        [,5]        [,6]

    Ghosh inverse matrix

    G <- ghosh_inverse(A)

    Multipliers

    Output multiplier

    out <- output_multiplier(L)

    Input multiplier

    inp <- input_multiplier(G)

    Income multiplier

    inc <- income_multiplier(L,w)

    Summary of multipliers

    sm <- cbind(out,inp,inc)
rownames(sm) <- rownames(X)
colnames(sm) <- c("output_multiplier", "input_multiplier", "income_multiplier")
sm
#>                                      output_multiplier input_multiplier
#> agriculture_fishing                           1.890084         1.890084
#> mining                                        1.565594         1.565594
#> manufacturing_industry                        1.884156         1.884156

    Linkages

    Backward and forward linkage

    bl <- backward_linkage(A)
fl <- forward_linkage(A)
bfl <- cbind(bl,fl)
rownames(bfl) <- rownames(X)
colnames(bfl) <- c("backward_linkage", "forward_linkage")
bfl
#>                                      backward_linkage forward_linkage
#> agriculture_fishing                         0.4963879      0.28767403
#> mining                                      0.3431237      0.12264465
#> manufacturing_industry                      0.5055072      0.86912923
#> electricity_gas_water                       0.4856295      0.49142145
#> construction                                0.4867352      0.32223702
#> retail_hotels_restaurants                   0.4617742      0.42446699
#> transport_communications_information        0.3930415      0.56097116
#> financial_services                          0.2881891      0.32954644
#> real_state                                  0.2173270      0.15866406
#> business_services                           0.2831318      0.76983671
#> personal_services                           0.2428914      0.05920631
#> public_administration                       0.2113550      0.01929541

    Power of dispersion

    bl <- power_dispersion(L)
bl_cv <- power_dispersion_cv(L)
bl_t <- cbind(bl,bl_cv)
rownames(bl_t) <- rownames(X)
colnames(bl_t) <- c("power_dispersion", "power_dispersion_cv")
bl_t
#>                                      power_dispersion power_dispersion_cv

    Sensitivity of dispersion

    sl <- sensitivity_dispersion(L)
sl_cv <- sensitivity_dispersion_cv(L)
sl_t <- cbind(sl,sl_cv)
rownames(sl_t) <- rownames(X)
colnames(sl_t) <- c("power_dispersion", "power_dispersion_cv")
sl_t

    Induced effects (labor/consumption)

    bli <- backward_linkage(A_aug)
fli <- forward_linkage(A_aug)
bfli <- cbind(bli,fli)
rownames(bfli) <- c(rownames(X), "wage")
# wie = with induced effect
colnames(bfli) <- c("backward_linkage_wie", "forward_linkage_wie")
bfli
#>                                      backward_linkage_wie forward_linkage_wie
#> agriculture_fishing                             0.6425565          0.39776052
#> mining                                          0.4334613          0.12319584
#> manufacturing_industry                          0.6093074          1.13026830
#> electricity_gas_water                           0.5500540          0.70151466
#> construction                                    0.7277364          0.32275859
#> retail_hotels_restaurants                       0.7125147          0.94695504
